question: Question_C_04
statement:
Shown in the figure below is the view from above of the path taken by a
penguin from point A to a feeding area on the shore at point C. The
penguin must choose the point B toward which it starts walking. It takes
twice as much energy per unit distance for the penguin to walk over land
(AB) as to swim through water (BC). The distance AD is 300 m and the
distance DC is 400 m. Calculate the value of the distance \emph{x} (and
hence the location of the point B - see figure) that minimizes the
energy spent on the entire trip.
